questions.question: Which line from the poem provides context that supports the meaning of the word grazing in line 8?

choices.answer: Line 9They ripple tensely, they can hardly contain their happiness.
Line 14-They begin munching the young tufts of spring in the darkness.

questions.question: Which definition best matches the use of the word "contain" in line 9? "They can hardly contain their happiness"

choices.answer: to hold or be capable of holding within a fixed limit or area
to keep (one’s feelings, behavior, etc.) within bounds; restrain
to prevent (enemy forces) from operating beyond a certain level or area

questions.question: Which of these lines contains poetic language that conveys a sense of gentleness?

choices.answer: And the eyes of those two Indian ponies Darken with kindness
At home once more, They begin munching the young tufts of spring in the dar
We step over the barbed wire into the pasture Where they have been grazing
he is black and white, Her mane falls wild on her forehead,

questions.question: Which of these best describes the structure of the poem?

choices.answer: Triplets of three successive rhyming lines
Unrhymed lines all in the same meter
Free verse with no rhyme or meter

questions.question: Read line 12 from the poem: There is no loneliness like theirs What tones are conveyed by this line?
Lines 13 and 14 suggest that the ponies---At home once more, they begin munching...

choices.answer: are in a comfortable and familiar place
have not had a chance to eat for a while
are excited to see their visitors

questions.question: In line 7, the act of stepping over barbed wire represents the speaker’s —
The simile in line 11-They bow shyly as wet swans.

choices.answer: suggests that the ponies have been in the rain
describes how the speaker and his friend interact with the ponies
presents the ponies as timid and graceful

questions.question: . Through the use of the first person point of view in this poem, the narrator

choices.answer: describes what his friend does at the scene
provides a sense of distance from his friend
outlines carefully what he observes and feels
shifts focus from a larger perspective to a closer view

questions.question: The first line of the poem serves to- Just off the highway to Rochester, Minnesota.
Which creatures in “Predators” are domesticated? Choose TWO options.
When the speaker in “Predators” says, “In sun the fox / bows to my feline and her good / dog friends who rule this land,

choices.answer: The fox feels embarrassed when it sees the pets.
The fox understands that the cat and dogs know best.
The fox does not approach when the cat and dogs arearound.
The fox wants to hunt the other animals that live on theproperty.

questions.question: In “Predators,” whose “sorry looks” is the speaker watching at the end of the poem?
What is the “bevy of vixen” doing at the end of “Predators”?

choices.answer: running back into the wild woods

questions.question: Which of the following people would be most likely to cultivate land? Base your answer on the meaning of cultivate.
What does the speaker in “Predators” mean when she refers to “my feline and her good dog friends”?

choices.answer: Both the dogs and the cat want to be like the wild foxesthey see.
She feels a closer relationship to the cat than to thedogs.
The cat only pretends to get along with the dogs.
The dogs are tame and mean the cat no harm.

questions.question: What is one major theme of “Predators”?

choices.answer: the natural world vs. the civilized world

questions.question: “I cannot smell the scent of the cat / who slept on this sweater,” with whom/what is she most likely comparing herself?
…I hoe and cultivate, find my dead aim in the trust that many tales spun this tract long before I came WHAT do these lin

choices.answer: She is irritated at having to work.
She appreciates the history of her land.
She enjoys telling stories about her home.

questions.question: The final stanza: feed on a much smaller body not the cat’s … But it could be.  What is true of this stanza?

choices.answer: It is far shorterthan the other stanzas.
It is made up of several separate sentences.
It has adifferent topic from the other stanzas.
It is spaced differently from the other stanzas.

questions.question: In general, what is true of the lines in “Predators”?

choices.answer: Each line represents one complete thought.
Some lines end one sentence and start another.
Each pair of lines represents a whole sentence.
The lines begin with a capital letter and end with aperiod.

Which theme do “A Blessing” and “Predators” share?
In “A Blessing” and “Predators,” animals are described as “bowing.” What is the main effect of this image?

choices.answer: It shows who is in charge and who is not.
It indicates the animals’ fun-loving nature.
It reveals the speakers’ opinions of their pets.
It describes a particular physical quality of animals.

questions.question: In “Predators,” if the poet wanted to use a synonym for scent that had a more negative connotation.   Which word would s
Which of the following words has a negative connotation?
Stanzas in poetry are named by...

choices.answer: The number of words in each sentence.
The number of lines that they contain.
The total length of the entire poem.

questions.question: What is the definition of cultivate?

choices.answer: To explore and discover new places.
